page.title: 10Quarrying near Eryrys.
page.content: Burley Hill Quarry occupies an area of about 16 hectares in the north west of the block. The quarry is at least pre-war and may be much older. High grade limestone is quarried here, it is removed by controlled and monitored blasting and carried by dump trucks to be crushed and graded into size. It is used in the construction industry and for the production of tarmacadam. The stone is carried from the quarry in lorries to areas including Clwyd, Merseyside, Cheshire, Greater Manchester and the Midlands. The equipment at the quarry is very modern and has cost Â£4.5 million over the last seven years. The quarry is about 20-30m deep but will become deeper with futher extraction. The quarry employs about 25 persons, some from the immediate area and also provides work for local lorry drivers.
